The Captain saw that he was running a great risk in standing on, for if he was brought to his vessel might be seized for infringing the blockade; as he knew the Brazilians would advance any pretext for the purpose of getting possession of his vessel and cargo.

The risk of detention in such a region can be understood by all; but few, perhaps, will appreciate the feeling of mingled passion and regret with which the leading vessel in such a mission as we had in hand found herself obliged to wait to close her consort, when all was water ahead, and the chances of it remaining so were but slight.
